channel.title: Stable Emu to build on?
channel.description:
Hi there,
Its been a long time since i last been on the Mopar forums and even a long time since i last designed a RSC world. I just have a few easy questions where i probally already have the answers for, but i'd like to make sure i am correct.
Best "Stable" emulator : RSCA/RSCD or EasyRSC? Best emulator to start all over again? ( World/Quests ) : RSCA/RSCD or EasyRSC? Best web intergrated emulator : RSCA/RSCD or EasyRSC?
And possable download links to : Map editor, Sprite editor, RSCA emulator,
Extra usefull programs i might not have posted.
Thanks, Royal.

item.title: Stable Emu to build on?
item.dc:creator: @RoyalChaos RoyalChaos
item.description:
@RoyalChaos wrote:

Even a older version is not solving the issue.

Read full topic

item.title: Stable Emu to build on?
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

For the time being, download and install the older JDK - 1.6 update 27. That is compatible with the old code.

http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk-6u27-download-440405.html

Read full topic

item.title: Stable Emu to build on?
item.dc:creator: @RoyalChaos RoyalChaos
item.description:
@RoyalChaos wrote:

[quote=“cleako, post:13, topic:418150”]Yes but the way things are right now, I would rather take an already functional game engine and build with it. Its more fun for me to design and create, rather than program. Its just a hobby.

RoyalChaos, I had that same error but I thought I solved it through replacing xmlpull.jar. I am using apache-ant-1.8.2.

Its overkill but I have added all of the JAR files from my lib folder to this zip file. Try replacing all of yours and see if I forgot one that I may have updated. I have also begun using Netbeans and… it is amazing. I have used Eclipse and Notepad++ but Netbeans has made Java programming so much more efficient for me that I would recommend it to anyone.

MediaFire

MediaFire

MediaFire is a simple to use free service that lets you put all your photos, documents, music, and video in a single place so you can access them anywhere and share them everywhere.


Hey thanks again for attempting to fix this.
Though this is not solving the error, i am also using apache-ant-1.8.2.

Read full topic

item.title: Stable Emu to build on?
item.dc:creator: @RoyalChaos RoyalChaos
item.description:
@RoyalChaos wrote:

[quote=“cleako, post:10, topic:418150”]RoyalChaos, it looks like you are using JDK 1.7.0 from the look of that error.

I solved the error through replacing xmlpull.jar and xtream.jar with the current versions of each. Here is a zip file with the updated files to put in your lib folder.

MediaFire

MediaFire

MediaFire is a simple to use free service that lets you put all your photos, documents, music, and video in a single place so you can access them anywhere and share them everywhere.


Appreciated your attempt though theirs still 10 errors remaining. It might be because my computer been quite a mess. Or the source is a mess.

Read full topic

item.title: Stable Emu to build on?
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

CodeForFame,

Your right about all of those things. The more I look at MoparRSC, the more I like it. It is my goal to take a server base, delete all of the game content, and create a new game while using the engine. I am not ready yet to code an engine from scratch so I am sticking with what I am familiar with. I want to document every step of the game content creation along with how the game engine works and open it to the public under the same open source design as MoparRSC and DarkQuest. Many people would like to learn the different aspects of game design and programming but the curve is still pretty steep and a project like that could be fairly popular.

RoyalChaos, it looks like you are using JDK 1.7.0 from the look of that error.

I solved the error through replacing xmlpull.jar and xtream.jar with the current versions of each. Here is a zip file with the updated files to put in your lib folder.

http://www.mediafire.com/?zhp100qz9599opq

Read full topic

item.title: Stable Emu to build on?
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“cleako, post:7, topic:418150”]Things here and there. The e-mail alerts system is in place but only has two test events that will trigger it. The Moparscape forum authentication looks done but I have not yet figured out how to test it with a SMF installation. There is a lot of room for plugins to be added. DarkQuest has a great deal in terms of listeners (action and executive), minigames, quests, and skills. I am not yet sure if they are compatible or at least similar yet. The npchandler folder contains duplicates of many of the NPC BSH scripts from looking at it, maybe they interact with them, I don’t know yet. Those could be either completely BSH or made into NPC plugins that interact with the listeners as they are in DarkQuest. The skills plugin folder contains the mining skill but there are several more that can be added. DarkQuest has 9 plugin skills total. MoparRSC still utilizes XML for the game server NPC/Item defs and locs, objects, doors, and shops. DarkQuest moved all of that into MySQL and being able to manipulate the data with a website has utility.

Overall the additions that you contributed to MoparRSC are spot on but the RSCA source feels a whole lot more rough compared to the changes Peeter made to it with DarkQuest. If you were to take DarkQuest (pre-revision 70’s points system) and made the same changes… rawr.[/quote]The alert system isn’t to spam the shit out of everyone on it, it’s for important things. If you have suggestions of what to add I’m all ears, but I really don’t see what else should be added.

You need to write a php page that either accepts or denies the credentials (essentially displays true or false). You don’t even need to integrate it with SMF, because there is nothing SMF specific.

The plugin system is garbage, and there really isn’t a valid reason to re-write the skills and make them plugins. Skills are rarely changed, and don’t really fit the nature of plugins, because they’re core content.

Duplicates of many NPC BSH scripts? I see one, and that’s Aggie. In addition, they work just fine. I’d like to re-do the system completely, but that’s a lot of work and I really don’t have time right now.

Manipulating that data isn’t really beneficial… It’s not like people are going to be moving absolutely everything around on a consistent basis. It’s better served in compressed XML files.

I’ve toyed around with DarkQuest and it’s just as rough in most places. Things he implemented were on the right track, but still nowhere near polished.

Read full topic

item.title: Stable Emu to build on?
item.dc:creator: @RoyalChaos RoyalChaos
item.description:
@RoyalChaos wrote:

I’ve just checked out the DarkQuest source.
I am just having a packer handler issue, due to fact that i haven’t been doing Java for a while i might need a hand here.
Been running with C++ for over a year and that is far from Java.

Code error LS/Server.bat :
[table]
[tr]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/table]
Note, that if you do not desire to help or discuss this. And rather flame me for not being able to find the issue here then i’d rather not have you responding on the topic it will not help you nor me.
[ Not to Judge, just to make clear ]

  • Mysql.
    Database and configs are properly created/set.

Read full topic

item.title: Stable Emu to build on?
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

Things here and there. The e-mail alerts system is in place but only has two test events that will trigger it. The Moparscape forum authentication looks done but I have not yet figured out how to test it with a SMF installation. There is a lot of room for plugins to be added. DarkQuest has a great deal in terms of listeners (action and executive), minigames, quests, and skills. I am not yet sure if they are compatible or at least similar yet. The npchandler folder contains duplicates of many of the NPC BSH scripts from looking at it, maybe they interact with them, I don’t know yet. Those could be either completely BSH or made into NPC plugins that interact with the listeners as they are in DarkQuest. The skills plugin folder contains the mining skill but there are several more that can be added. DarkQuest has 9 plugin skills total. MoparRSC still utilizes XML for the game server NPC/Item defs and locs, objects, doors, and shops. DarkQuest moved all of that into MySQL and being able to manipulate the data with a website has utility.

Overall the additions that you contributed to MoparRSC are spot on but the RSCA source feels a whole lot more rough compared to the changes Peeter made to it with DarkQuest. If you were to take DarkQuest (pre-revision 70’s points system) and made the same changes… rawr.

Read full topic

item.title: Stable Emu to build on?
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“cleako, post:2, topic:418150”]Look at the DarkQuest source too. I really like the MoparRSC source but it is still a work in progress and the client is not finished yet. Use the forum search to find the things you need. They have all been posted again recently with working links.[/quote]The only thing ‘wrong’ with the client is that it won’t run inside of Moparscape v4.

You can run it as a standalone application or applet just fine.

Also, what still needs to be worked on?

Read full topic
